alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 26 at 10:56AM MST until November 28 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches, with 6 to 12 inches expected above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow and reduced visibility will be the main impact.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
